body_html:
I don't know llvm's lit tool, but you can do

bazel test //tensorflow/python/...

to build all targets under //tensorflow/python

If you don't run with --config=cuda, you will not run any tests that require a GPU (our code should automatically skip tests that require a GPU to run).

If you want to run a specific target, you can do:

bazel test //tensorflow/python:constant_op_test

or something like that.
body_text:
I don't know llvm's lit tool, but you can do
bazel test //tensorflow/python/... 

to build all targets under //tensorflow/python
If you don't run with --config=cuda, you will not run any tests that require a GPU (our code should automatically skip tests that require a GPU to run).
If you want to run a specific target, you can do:
bazel test //tensorflow/python:constant_op_test

or something like that.
body:
I don't know llvm's lit tool, but you can do
```
bazel test //tensorflow/python/... 
```
to build all targets under //tensorflow/python

If you don't run with --config=cuda, you will not run any tests that require a GPU (our code *should* automatically skip tests that require a GPU to run).

If you want to run a specific target, you can do:
```
bazel test //tensorflow/python:constant_op_test
```
or something like that.
